info.name: Subarachnoid cisterns
info.description: Within the skull there are some places - particularly at the base of the brain where the subarachnoid space is widened to form large pools of cerebrospinal fluid called the subarachnoid cisterns.  They communicate freely with one another, as well as with the remainder of the subarachnoid space surrounding the brain and spinal cord.  The major cisterns are the cerebellomedullary (AKA cisterna magna), pontine, interpeduncular and superior (AKA quadrigeminal) cisterns.
